```{python}
#| label: fig-trx-lowif
#| echo: false
#| fig-cap: "Block diagram of a low-IF transceiver (TRX) showing the main functional blocks of RX and TX. Note the usage of complex analog and digital baseband filters. Otherwise, the structure is similar to a zero-IF TRX as shown in @fig-trx-block." 
import schemdraw as sd
import schemdraw.elements as elm
import schemdraw.dsp as dsp

sd.svgconfig.svg2 = False

with sd.Drawing(canvas='svg') as d:
    d.config(unit=2, fontsize=14)

    rf_pos=d.here

    dsp.Arrow().right(d.unit/2).label(r'$s_\mathrm{RX}$', 'left')
    dsp.Amp()
    dsp.Line().right(d.unit/4).dot()

    # RX I path
    d.push()
    dsp.Line().up(d.unit)
    dsp.Arrow().right(d.unit/4)
    mix1 = dsp.Mixer()
    dsp.Arrow().length(d.unit*2)
    dsp.Ic(pins=[dsp.IcPin(side='L'), dsp.IcPin(side='L'), dsp.IcPin(side='R')], size=(1, 5), leadlen=0).anchor('inL2').color('gray')
    lpf1 = dsp.Filter(response='bp')
    dsp.Arrow().length(d.unit/4)
    dsp.Amp()
    dsp.Arrow().length(d.unit/4)
    adc1 = dsp.Adc().label('ADC')
    dsp.Arrow().length(d.unit/4)
    dsp.Ic(pins=[dsp.IcPin(side='L'), dsp.IcPin(side='L'), dsp.IcPin(side='R')], size=(1, 5), leadlen=0).anchor('inL2').color('gray')
    dsp.Square().label('DSP')
    dsp.Arrow().length(d.unit/2).label(r'$s_\mathrm{RX,I}$', 'right')

    dsp1 = dsp.Ic(pins=[dsp.IcPin(side='L'), dsp.IcPin(side='L'), dsp.IcPin(side='R')], size=(2.75, 12), leadlen=0).anchor('inL2').label('MODEM')

    d.pop()

    # RX Q path
    d.push()
    dsp.Line().down(d.unit)
    dsp.Arrow().right(d.unit/4)
    mix2 = dsp.Mixer()
    dsp.Arrow().length(d.unit*2)
    lpf2 = dsp.Filter(response='bp')
    dsp.Arrow().length(d.unit/4)
    dsp.Amp()
    dsp.Arrow().length(d.unit/4)
    adc2 = dsp.Adc().label('ADC')
    dsp.Arrow().length(d.unit/4)
    dsp.Square().label('DSP')
    dsp.Arrow().length(d.unit/2).label(r'$s_\mathrm{RX,Q}$', 'right')
    d.pop()

    # PLL
    d.move(dx=d.unit/4)
    iq1 = dsp.Square().label('0/90°')
    dsp.Arrow().at(iq1.N).up(d.unit/2)
    dsp.Arrow().at(iq1.S).down(d.unit/2)
    dsp.Arrow().at(iq1.E).right(d.unit/4).reverse()
    osc1 = dsp.Oscillator()
    dsp.Line().right(d.unit/4)
    pll1 = dsp.Square().label('PLL')
    
    # Transmitter section (mirrored below)
    # Start from beginning of the diagram and move down
    d.here = rf_pos
    d.move(dx=0, dy=-d.unit*3.5)

    dsp.Arrow().right(d.unit/2).label(r'$s_\mathrm{TX}$', 'left').reverse()
    dsp.Amp().reverse()
    dsp.Arrow().right(d.unit/4).dot().reverse()

    # TX I path
    d.push()
    dsp.Line().up(d.unit)
    dsp.Line().right(d.unit/4)
    mix3 = dsp.Mixer()
    dsp.Arrow().length(d.unit*2).reverse()

    dsp.Ic(pins=[dsp.IcPin(side='L'), dsp.IcPin(side='L'), dsp.IcPin(side='R')], size=(1, 5), leadlen=0).anchor('inL2').color('gray')
    lpf3 = dsp.Filter(response='bp')
    dsp.Arrow().length(d.unit/4).reverse()
    dsp.Amp().reverse()
    dsp.Arrow().length(d.unit/4).reverse()
    dac1 = dsp.Adc().label('DAC')
    dsp.Arrow().length(d.unit/4).reverse()
    dsp.Ic(pins=[dsp.IcPin(side='L'), dsp.IcPin(side='L'), dsp.IcPin(side='R')], size=(1, 5), leadlen=0).anchor('inL2').color('gray')
    dsp.Square().label('DSP')
    dsp.Arrow().length(d.unit/2).label(r'$s_\mathrm{TX,I}$', 'right').reverse()
    d.pop()

   # TX Q path
    d.push()
    dsp.Line().down(d.unit)
    dsp.Line().right(d.unit/4)
    mix4 = dsp.Mixer()
    dsp.Arrow().length(d.unit*2).reverse()
    lpf4 = dsp.Filter(response='bp')
    dsp.Arrow().length(d.unit/4).reverse()
    dsp.Amp().reverse()
    dsp.Arrow().length(d.unit/4).reverse()
    dac2 = dsp.Adc().label('DAC')
    dsp.Arrow().length(d.unit/4).reverse()
    dsp.Square().label('DSP')
    dsp.Arrow().length(d.unit/2).label(r'$s_\mathrm{TX,Q}$', 'right').reverse()
    d.pop()

    # PLL
    d.move(dx=d.unit/4)
    iq2 = dsp.Square().label('0/90°')
    dsp.Arrow().at(iq2.N).up(d.unit/2)
    dsp.Arrow().at(iq2.S).down(d.unit/2)
    dsp.Arrow().at(iq2.E).right(d.unit/4).reverse()
    osc2 = dsp.Oscillator()
    dsp.Line().right(d.unit/4)
    pll2 = dsp.Square().label('PLL')

```
